page.title: 03CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Mrs.Babbage,our school cook,remembers Widegates when it had 2 grocers,a petrol pump and shed butcher,hairdress draper and Post Office.Mrs.Lake's house,Lane End used to be two houses one up and one down.There was no toilet inside."I can see Granfer Bonney carrying his pail to the garden shed toilets where there was no flush just buckets which had to be empitied in a pit in the garden." Mrs.B's mother had a shed with a well inside. The pump was taken out and the well boarded over.During the war a District Nurse lived in this shed.It was a bed,kitchen and living room all in one with only an oil lamp and heater.Girl evacuees went to Trenode school,the boys used the Sunday school room. There were strawberry gardens at Colvase,remains of the greenhouses can still be seen.
